com.netflix.genie.agent.execution.statemachine

Interface JobExecutionStateMachine

  • All Superinterfaces:
    org.springframework.context.ApplicationListener<KillService.KillEvent>, java.util.EventListener

    public interface JobExecutionStateMachine
extends org.springframework.context.ApplicationListener<KillService.KillEvent>
    Interface JobExecutionStateMachine.
    Since:
    4.0.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void start()
      Starts the state machine and returns.
      void stop()
      Force an early termination of the state machine, in response to user submitting a kill via API or ctrl-c.
      States waitForStop()
      Waits for the state machine to stop executing.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.springframework.context.ApplicationListener

        onApplicationEvent

    • Method Detail

      • start

        void start()
        Starts the state machine and returns.

      • waitForStop

        States waitForStop()
            throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Waits for the state machine to stop executing.
        Returns:
        the final state in which the machine stopped
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the waiting thread is interrupted

      • stop

        void stop()
        Force an early termination of the state machine, in response to user submitting a kill via API or ctrl-c. Notice: - State actions are not interrupted. Only after the one currently executing is completed the stop signal is processed (TODO: make long-running actions, such as setup, interruptible). - Some actions are still performed before the program exits. For example publish the updated job status server-side. Refer to the StateMachineAutoConfiguration for details.
